page_content: Profile: Dr. Ananya Mitra. Role: Assistant Professor- II. Bio: Dr. Ananya Mitra is an Assistant Professor in Economics with a PhD in Analytical and Applied Economics from Utkal University. With 18 years of experience in teaching Economics to engineering students, she specializes in applied economics and has a strong focus on bridging theoretical concepts with practical applications. Dr. Mitra serves as the course coordinator for various programs, including the Minor in Financial Economics (using Data Analytics) and Minor in Sustainable Development, Open Elective for B.Tech, M.Sc and M.Tech students. Her research interests lie in the intersection of economics and data analytics, and she is dedicated to advancing the understanding of economic principles in technical and interdisciplinary contexts.. Details: Email: ananya.mitrafhu@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57224897395, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.co.in/citations?hl=en&user=PtCK7NAAAAAJ, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-7257-233X. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: Ph.D in Analytical and Applied Economics from Utkal University COURSE EXPERTISE: Engineering Economics RESEARCH INTERESTS: Economics of education, Economics of crime, Tourism Administrative Responsibilities: FIC of minor courses (B.Tech) Professional Membership: OEA, OCA, ICC

Profile: Dr. Arvind Kumar Yadav. Role: Assistant Professor- I. Bio: Dr. Arvind Kumar Yadav, is an Assistant Professor of Economics specializing in health economics and applied econometrics. Dr. Yadav completed his B.A. (University of Lucknow), M.A. (Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar University), MPhil (Central University of Punjab), and Ph.D. at Shri Mata Vaishno Devi University, where he conducted in-depth research on Maternal Health. He has published 23 research papers in various esteemed journals, including SCI, ESCI, SSCI, SCOPUS, Q1, Q2, ABDC, and PubMed Central, making significant contributions to public health policy and economic research. He has invited as an expert to deliver a lecture on “Econometric Modelling” in various State and Central Universities and prestegious bodies like RFAISR (under the aegis of NITI Aayog) and Mentor Most (PGIMER).. Details: Email: arvind.yadavfcm@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=59720578600, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=IZtaiQUAAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3654-2584. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: PhD (Economics) COURSE EXPERTISE: Microeconomics, Applied Econometrics, Statistics, Data Management Processing and Analysis, Health Economics RESEARCH INTERESTS: Health Economics, Health & Environment, Digital Health, Health Expenditure (From Pocket to Policy) Administrative Responsibilities: FIC-KIITX online Program, FIC-Admission, FIC-Social Media Outreach Activity: Education for All [Shaileshshree Vihar, Bhubaneswar], STTP 2025, Art of Giving Professional Membership: TAEC, OEA

Profile: Dr. Gayatri Nayak. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Dr. Gayatri Nayak, is an Assistant Professor of Economics specializing in Managerial economics and labour economics. Dr. Nayak completed his B.A. (FM University), M.A. (FM University), MPhil (FM University), and Ph.D. at FM University, where he conducted in-depth research on labour economics. She has published 3 research papers in various esteemed journals, making significant contributions to labour economics policy and economic research. She has invited as an expert to deliver a lecture on “Labour Economics” FM University.. Details: Email: gayatri.nayakfcm@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/pages/home?display=basic#basic, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=_JXrD48AAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0009-0000-1354-9711. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: PhD (Economics) COURSE EXPERTISE: Managerial Economics, Labour Economics, Advanced Microeconomics RESEARCH INTERESTS: Labour Economics Administrative Responsibilities: FIC-Library, FIC- IQAC Outreach Activity: Organised Education for All workshop at Shaileshshree Vihar, Bhubaneswar in 2025 and Art of Giving Professional Membership: OEA

Profile: Dr. Lopamudra Lenka. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Dr. Lopamudra Lenka is currently serving as an Assistant Professor of Economics at the KIIT School of Economics & Commerce, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar, India. She earned her Ph.D. in Economics from Symbiosis International (Deemed University), Pune, and a Master’s from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar. She has served as a Guest Faculty at the National Defence Academy, Pune, and worked as an Insurance Analyst with Spandana Spoorthy Financial Limited, Hyderabad. She has published widely in reputable journals and presented her research papers at both national and international conferences. Her research interests include Migration, Rural and Agricultural Economics, Development Economics, and Environmental Sustainability.. Details: Email: lopamudra.lenkafcm@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/results/authorNamesList.uri?name=name&st1=Lenka&st2=Lopamudra&origin=searchauthorlookup, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=1zQjOegAAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: https://orcid.org/orcid-search/search?searchQuery=0009-0004-9621-6080. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: Ph.D. in Economics from Symbiosis International University COURSE EXPERTISE: Agricultural Economics, Indian Economy, Environmental Economics, Development Economics RESEARCH INTERESTS: Migration, Reverse Migration, Rural Economics, Agricultural Economics Environmental Sustainability Administrative Responsibilities: Convenor for Student Affairs & Activities, FIC for Industry Engagement Professional Membership: Lifetime Member of Odisha Economic Association, Lifetime Member of The Applied Economics Society

Profile: Dr. Manas Kumar Pedi. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Dr. Manas Kumar Pedi is an Assistant Professor and Assistant Controller of Examination at the School of Economics and Commerce, KIIT Deemed to be University. With an M.Phil. and Ph.D. in Economics from the Central University of Gujarat and a Postgraduate degree from Pondicherry University, he has five years of teaching experience, mentoring undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral students. His research interests include economic growth, human capital mobility, rural development, public policy, and agriculture, with work presented at national and international conferences and published in prestigious journals. His teaching expertise spans Microeconomics, Economic Growth and Development, Research Methodology, and the Indian Economy.. Details: Email: manas.pedifcm@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57223901318, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=sAqABiMAAAAJ&hl=en&authuser=1, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-6890-7819. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: Ph.D in Economics from Central University of Gujarat COURSE EXPERTISE: Microeconomics, Economic growth and development, Indian Economy RESEARCH INTERESTS: Economic growth and Convergence, Human Capital Mobility, Rural Development Administrative Responsibilities: Assistant Controller of Examinations Professional Membership: Orissa Economic Association Patents and Innovations: System and Method for Enhancing Organizational Behaviour Through Adaptive Cognitive Analysis

Profile: Dr. Motiniva Nayak. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Motiniva Nayak is an Assistant Professor of Economics at the School of Economics and Commerce, KIIT-DU, Bhubaneswar. She previously held assistant professor positions at the Centre for Undergraduate Studies, Tata Institute of Social Sciences (Guwahati Off-Campus), and the Department of Economics, Central University of Rajasthan. She has also served as Visiting Faculty at Xavier Institute of Management University, Bhubaneswar, and as Guest Faculty at Sambalpur University. She strongly advocates for teaching and understanding economics from multiple perspectives is very urgent in addressing development challenges with effective policy solutions. Her doctoral research focused on access to finance and economic performance among micro, small, and medium enterprises in India from 1970 to 2010.. Details: Email: motiniva.nayakfcm@kiit.ac.in, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0002-5271-9549. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: BA(Economics(Honours), Statistics from Gangadhar Meher College(Present day GM University));MA(Centre for Economic Studies and Planning(CESP),JNU); Mphil(CESP,JNU);PhD(CESP,JNU) COURSE EXPERTISE: BASS: Indian Economy, Classical Political Economy, Introduction to Economics, BA PAG: Economics and Public Policy, Microeconomic Theory and Public Policy, Macroeconomics for Public Policy Analysis; Integrated MSc in Economics: History of Economic,Thought Introductory Econometrics; MA and MSc:Macroeconomics I, Statistical Methods in Economics, Mathematical Methods in Economics, Economics of Development,Theories of Economic Growth, Economics of Human Development RESEARCH INTERESTS: Role of Industry in development; Role of finance in development of industry; Development problems faced by Industry in general and financial constraints of MSMEs in India in particular Administrative Responsibilities: FIC International Relation, KSEC; FIC-cum-Convenor TMCC,KSEC

Profile: Dr. Motiniva Nayak. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Motiniva Nayak is an Assistant Professor of Economics at the School of Economics and Commerce, KIIT-DU, Bhubaneswar. She previously held assistant professor positions at the Centre for Undergraduate Studies, Tata Institute of Social Sciences (Guwahati Off-Campus), and the Department of Economics, Central University of Rajasthan. She has also served as Visiting Faculty at Xavier Institute of Management University, Bhubaneswar, and as Guest Faculty at Sambalpur University. She strongly advocates for teaching and understanding economics from multiple perspectives is very urgent in addressing development challenges with effective policy solutions. Her doctoral research focused on access to finance and economic performance among micro, small, and medium enterprises in India from 1970 to 2010.. Profile: Dr. Muhammed Najeeb K K. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Dr. Muhammed Najeeb K.K. is an Assistant Professor of Economics at the School of Economics, and Commerce, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He holds a Ph.D. in Economics from the Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur, where his research focused on the intersection of institutions, education, and demographic transition in economic growth. His academic interests span macroeconomics, development economics, international trade, and institutional economics. Dr. Najeeb has authored multiple peer-reviewed publications and book chapters on ICT and trade, the Indian manufacturing sector, and environmental sustainability. Dr. Najeeb is proficient in empirical research tools including STATA and R, and actively collaborates on research addressing global development challenges.. Details: Email: muhammed.najeebfcm@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: #https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=59171702100, Google Scholar: #https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=U1paqnUAAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: #https://orcid.org/my-orcid?orcid=0000-0002-4968-8323. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: M.Phil in Economics from Central University of Kerala and P.hD from IIT Kharagpur COURSE EXPERTISE: Econometrics, Economic of Growth, Macroeconomics, and Development Economics RESEARCH INTERESTS: Economics of growth, Innovation and Technology Development, and Technology Diffusion Administrative Responsibilities: Faculty in charge of Economics and Coordinator of B.Sc. in Economics with Data Analysis Outreach Activity: Founding Member of SIGN, an HR NGO in Kerala

Profile: Dr. Prasanta Patri. Role: Assistant Professor-II. Bio: Dr. Prasanta Patri serves as an Assistant Professor-II of Economics at the School of Economics and Commerce, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. He holds a Ph.D. in Economics from IIT Indore, an MPhil from Ravenshaw University, and an MA in Applied Economics from Pondicherry University. His research interests span Climate Change, Disaster Management, Environmental Economics, Econometrics, Health and Sanitation. Dr. Patri has gained extensive teaching and research experience at reputed institutions including IIM Bangalore, IIM Indore, NIT Rourkela, KIIMS Cuttack, and PJ Group of Institutions, Bhubaneswar. A recipient of the Climate Reporting Fellowship (YKA, India), he has published in globally indexed journals such as IJDRR (ABDC-A, Q1) and Mental Health and Social Inclusion (Scopus), Economic and Regional Studies(Scopus).. Details: Email: prasanta.patrifcm@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57224854974, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=yD6VDhcAAAAJ&hl=en&oi=aoResearch, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-4949-1261. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: PhD in Economics: Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Indore, MP, India
MPhil in Economics: Ravenshaw University, Cuttack, Odisha, India
MA in Applied Economics: Pondicherry University (Central), Puducherry, India
BA with Economics (Honors): BJB Autonomous College (Utkal University), Bhubaneswar, Odisha, India COURSE EXPERTISE: Econometrics, Micro Economics, Environment Economics, Engineering Economics RESEARCH INTERESTS: Climate Change Economics, Disaster Management, Environment and Development Economics, Heath and sanitation Administrative Responsibilities: Faculty in charge Examination Awards and Achievements: Institute Fellowship, Indian Institute of Technology Indore, MP, India
Climate Reporting Fellowship”: Climate Reporting Fellow at Youth Ki Awaz (YKA), India Outreach Activity: “Identifying and assessing the impact of Market Based Mechanisms on India’s international sea trade” presented to Directorate General of Sea Shipping, Govt. of India, 9th floor, Beta Building, Mumbai-400042 (India), as Research Associate.
 Ministry of Tribal Affairs (MoTA), Government of India, Project at Centre of Excellence for Tribal Studies, National Institute of Technology Rourkela, as Research Associate

Profile: Dr. Sanjaya Kumar Lenka. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. Sanjaya Kumar Lenka, Ph.D. in Economics from IIT Indore, has over 9 years of teaching and research experience. He specializes in Macroeconomics, Money and Banking, and Applied Econometrics, with a focus on Financial Inclusion, Financial Technology, and Green Growth. Dr. Lenka has published in journals like Financial Innovation (Springer), Journal of Financial Economic Policy (Emerald), and Cogent Economics & Finance (Taylor & Francis). He has worked at the Institute of Economic Growth, DIT University, and CHRIST University. He is an Editorial member of SN Business & Economics (Springer) and advises doctoral dissertations at the Centre for Economic and Social Studies, Hyderabad.. Details: Email: sanjaya.lenkafcm@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: #https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57195397787, Google Scholar: #https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=kvpCIlgAAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: #https://orcid.org/0000-0001-9353-6872. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: M.A. in Economics from Fakir Mohan University, M.Phil. in Economics from North Orissa University, Ph.D. in Economics from IIT Indore COURSE EXPERTISE: Macroeconomics, Money and Banking, Public Finance, Development Economics, Research Methods, and Applied Econometrics. RESEARCH INTERESTS: Financial Inclusion, Financial Technology, Digital Finance, Energy Finance, Green Growth, Green FDI, Human Development Administrative Responsibilities: Faculty In-Charge of IQAC, KSEC,
Faculty In-Charge of Publications & IPR, KSEC, Awards and Achievements: Received certificate of appreciation and incentives for “Excellence in Research” during the academic year: 2019-20 from DIT University, Dehradun.
 Received Senior Research Fellowship (Jan 2014 to Dec 2016) from MHRD at School of Humanities and Social Sciences, Indian Institute of Technology Indore.
 Received Junior Research Fellowship (Jan 2012 to Dec 2013) from MHRD at School of Humanities and Social Sciences, Indian Institute of Technology Indore. Professional Membership: Life Member of Odisha Economic Association (OEA)

Profile: Dr. Sarbeswar Mohanty. Role: Associate Professor II. Bio: Dr Sarbeswar Mohanty is an Associate Professor in the School of Economics and Commerce, Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT) Deemed to be University, India. His research focuses on agricultural economics, macroeconomics and Development economics, and has published extensively in international journals indexed in Scopus and Web of Science (WOS), all of which are listed in the ABDC Quality List. His teaching interests include Micro Economics, Money and Banking, Development Economics, Engineering Economics, HRM, and Management Concepts and Practices. Details: Email: smohantyfhu@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57200620137, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=TqTsfqMAAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: https://orcid.org/my-orcid?orcid=0009-0003-0611-7381. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: MA, M.Phil. MBA, Ph.D. COURSE EXPERTISE: MICRO ECONOMICS, ENGINEERING ECONOMICS, ECONOMICS OF DEVELOPMENT, MONEY & BANKING, HRM, MANAGEMENT CONCEPTS & PRACTICES RESEARCH INTERESTS: AGRICULTUR ECONOMICS, MACROECONOMICS, DEVELOPMENT ECONOMICS Administrative Responsibilities: MEMBER ACADEMIC COMMITTEE, MEMBER SLRC Outreach Activity: ART OF GIVING, EDUCATION FOR ALL

Profile: Dr. Saswat Kishore Mishra. Role: Associate Dean, Associate Professor I. Bio: Dr. Mishra is a seasoned economist with over 10 years of experience in teaching and research. Holding a Ph.D. in Economics from IIT Kharagpur, he has received prestigious fellowships from UGC and ICSSR. His research focuses on Rural Development, Public Health, Environmental Economics, and Geopolitical Economy. Currently, he leads research projects on mining and climate resilience, sponsored by ICSSR. Dr. Mishra has worked with various organizations, including the MoRD, PHFI, and NABARD. He has conducted numerous training programmes and presented papers at globally renowned institutions, including the World Bank and Erasmus University. As an Executive Committee Member of the OEA, Dr. Mishra continues to contribute to the field of economics through research, teaching, and policy engagement.. Details: Email: saswat.mishrafcm@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57199691722, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=LLFkMIUAAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-8464-0459. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: PhD in Economics from IIT Kharagpur COURSE EXPERTISE: Microeconomics, Environmental and Resource Economics, Analytics and Research Methods, and Micro-econometrics RESEARCH INTERESTS: Economics of Rural Development, Public Health, Environmental and Resource Economics, Energy Economics, and Geopolitical Economy Administrative Responsibilities: Associate Dean (School of Economics and Commerce) Awards and Achievements: Awards & Fellowships:

Profile: Dr. Seba Mohanty. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr Seba Mohanty is working as an Assistant Professor Senior grade in Economics at KIIT School of Economics and Commerce, KIIT Deemed to be University, Patia, Bhubaneswar. She has done her Ph.D in Financial Economics from Indian Institute of Technology, Kharagpur. She has more than 10 years of teaching and research experience in different management institutes and universities in India. Her areas of research interests are Banking and Finance, Energy Finance, Climate Finance, and Macro Economics. She has published many research papers in different reputed journals.. Details: Email: seba.mohantyfhu@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=56857151600, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?hl=en&user=djtAklIAAAAJ, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-3231-535X. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: PhD in Financial Economics from IIT Kharagpur COURSE EXPERTISE: Financial Economics, Banking and Finace, Statistics, COrporate Finance, Macro Economics RESEARCH INTERESTS: Energy Finance, Climate Finance, Banking and Finance, Macro Economics Administrative Responsibilities: FIC of Research and Piblication Outreach Activity: Organised Education for all near Gothapatna, Khurdha , Bhubaneswar Professional Membership: OEA Life time member

Profile: Dr. Smrutirekha Mohanty. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. Smrutirekha Mohanty is an Assistant Professor in Economics at Kalinga Institute of Industrial Technology (KIIT). She has more than 17 years experience in teaching. As a teacher, she contributes to the education of students by teaching and guiding them in understanding economic theories, quantitative methods, and real-world applications. She has authored or co-authored research papers, articles, and conference proceedings on various topics such as Intellectual Property Rights (IPR), Sustainable development, Agriculture, Education and Culture. She actively participates in and organises various academic events to promote knowledge sharing and discussion on contemporary economic issues.. Details: Email: smrutirekha.mohantyfhu@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57643819400, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=3CP82xEAAAAJ&hl=en&authuser=1, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0009-0001-9593-1144. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: M.Phil in Economics, Ph.D in Economics COURSE EXPERTISE: Economics Subjects offerd to Engineering Students RESEARCH INTERESTS: Intellectual Property Rights(IPR), Sustainable Economics, Education, Cultural Studies Administrative Responsibilities: Couse Coordinator of Economics subjects coming under HASS -1, HASS-2 & HASS-3 Outreach Activity: Organised Education for All workshop at “Swami Bichitrananda Kalyan Ashram, Dagadpada, Cuttack” in 2025 Professional Membership: Odisha Economic Association(OEA), Indian Commerce Association(ICA), Indian Society of Agricultural Economics (ISAE) Patents and Innovations: Patent /Empowering Women Farmers in IPR Model, Smrutirekha Mohanty, 2023

Profile: Dr. Subhrajit Rath. Role: Associate Professor I. Bio: Dr. Subhrajit Rath is an Assistant Professor of Economics with over seven years of teaching and research experience. He has served at IIM Indore, Central University of Odisha, RIE Bhubaneswar, Utkal University, IFMR-LEAD, ASBM University, and NLU Odisha. He holds a Ph.D. in Economics from Utkal University, with research interests in welfare and financial economics, rural development, disaster resilience, and policy impact assessment. Dr. Rath has led projects on NALCO’s CSR impact and the mid-term evaluation of Ladli Laxmi Yojana, Govt. of Madhya Pradesh. His work is published in Scopus, Web of Science, and UGC-CARE indexed journals, along with book chapters, and has been presented at national and international conferences.. Details: Email: subhrajit.rathfcm@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57210518114, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Os9pIPQAAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-8324-5828. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: Ph.D. in Economics from Utkal University COURSE EXPERTISE: Econometrics and Data analytics RESEARCH INTERESTS: Finance and welfare economics Administrative Responsibilities: Faculty in charge for Admission, Faculty in charge for research in economics Outreach Activity: Organised Education for All workshop at Sailashree Vihar, Bhubaneswar in 2025

Profile: Dr. Sugyanta Priyadarshini. Role: Assistant Professor II. Bio: Dr. Sugyanta Priyadarshini is an Assistant Professor at the School of Economics and Commerce, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar. She earned her Ph.D. on the socio-economic status of trans women and has published widely on organic farming, sustainability, climate change, AI applications, and social development. She leads an ICSSR-funded project worth Rs. 80 Lakhs and is Co-PI in several national projects. A life member of the Odisha Economic Association and reviewer for reputed international journals, she has guided doctoral scholars and co-edited books on yoga, meditation, and technology.. Details: Email: sugyanta.priyadarshini@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57213403662, ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0001-7660-6162. Profile: Dr. Sukanta Chandra Swain. Role: Dean. Bio: Dr. Sukanta Chandra Swain is a Professor of Economics and Dean (Research) and Dean (I/C) of the School of Economics & Commerce, KIIT DU. Before taking up this assignment, he was the Dean, School of Humanities, KIIT DU. Prior to joining KIIT, he was with the Chartered Financial Analysts of India as the Professor and Associate Dean. He has 30 years of teaching experience out of which 10 years of experience is in academic administration. He has been successfully guiding research scholars in their doctoral degree and considerably contributing to the intellectual world. He has more than 100 publications. He was invited by NAAC-Bangalore to deliver talks on accreditation process and have discussion with the NAAC officials on how to improve the accreditation process.. Details: Email: sukanta.swainfhu@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: #https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57211980821, Google Scholar: #https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=STopP5sAAAAJ&hl=en, ORCID: #https://orcid.org/0000-0002-0432-071X. Additional Info: EDUCATIONAL QUALIFICATION: PG, M. Phil. & Ph. D. in Applied Economics from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar COURSE EXPERTISE: Managerial Economics, Macroeconomics, Engineering Economics, Research Methodology, Statistics, International Economics RESEARCH INTERESTS: Development Economics, Financial Economics, General Management Administrative Responsibilities: Dean (Research) and Dean (I/c)

Profile: Dr. Suvendu Barik. Role: Associate Professor II. Bio: Dr. Suvendu Barik, Senior Assistant Professor, KSEC, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar. With a strong academic foundation, Dr. Barik holds a Ph.D. from Jamia Millia Islamia (New Delhi) and did his M.Phil., Post Graduation and Graduation from Odisha. He has also qualified UGC-NET, demonstrating his expertise in his field. Dr. Barik brings over five years of teaching experience and more than four years of research and analytical expertise to his role. He has worked with esteemed organizations such as NUEPA, IIFT, NCERT, and the Planning Commission of India, contributing to significant educational and policy research projects. As a dedicated academician and researcher, Dr. Barik continues to make valuable contributions to the field of economics and education.. Details: Email: suvendu.barikfhu@kiit.ac.in, Scopus: https://www.scopus.com/authid/detail.uri?authorId=57844791000, Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Z2sRPjQAAAAJ&hl=en&oi=ao, ORCID: https://orcid.org/my-orcid?orcid=0000-0002-4274-3027. Profile: Dr. Swapnamoyee Palit. Role: Associate Professor I. Bio: Dr S.Palit has 20 years of teaching experience at UG and PG level. She has a first class career throughout from ICSE to M.Phil.. She has a professional degree in MBA in Finance from Pondicherry Central University. She is also UGC (NET) qualified in Economics. Besides, she has publications in various national and international journals as well as participations in such level conferences. She has her PhD degree in Health Economics. The topic of her thesis was ‘Health Care in Urban Odisha: A Study on Access, Utilisation and Equity’, She has also presented a paper in Sovemville college, Oxford University in 2019, using the samples. Her area of interest are international economics, Finance, Health Economics and tribal development.. Profile: Dr. Tulasi Malini Maharatha. Role: Assistant Professor I. Bio: Dr. Tulasi Malini Maharatha is an Assistant Professor (I) in the School of Social, Financial, and Human Sciences at KIIT University. She holds a Ph.D. in Economics from the Indian Institute of Technology, Madras, and an M.Phil. and Master’s degree in Analytical and Applied Economics from Utkal University. Her academic interests include Development Economics and Public Economics, particularly Health Economics. She has published research in Scopus-indexed and international journals and is experienced in using statistical and econometric software such as STATA, R, LISREL, LiST, and SPSS..
